executive_summary: Operators in the Handyman Service Franchises industry provide residential and commercial clients with a broad range of repair and maintenance services, spanning from painting projects and drywall repair to plumbing work and electrical system repairs. The industry derives most of its revenue from the residential sector, which includes homeowners and property managers. As a result, the industry expanded strongly over most of the five years to 2021, as the Construction sector (IBISWorld report 23) continued to improve. However, the outbreak of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic starting in 2020 has undermined the industry's otherwise steady growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Because the industry derives an estimated 68.2% of revenue from the residential market, trends in per capita disposable income, housing prices, homeownership rates and existing home sales are the most important demand determinants for handyman services. Based on data from the Case-Shiller U.S. National Home Price Index, home prices have increased an annualized 6.6% over the five years to 2021. This growth in home prices has encouraged homeowners to invest in home renovations and repairs to increase their property values.

However, the coronavirus pandemic has limited downstream demand from residential and commercial clients, albeit temporarily, translating into a decline in industry revenue. With shutdowns across the United States in 2020 and a rise in economic uncertainty, unemployment levels spiked during the year, undercutting demand for the Handyman Service Franchises industry. As more Americans have lost their jobs and have been forced to work from home, more individuals have been able to undertake DIY projects, choosing to forego industry operators.

Nonetheless, demand was buttressed by strong government income support to Americans, epically the unemployed. Notably, the federal government passed the Coronavirus Aid, Relief & Economic Security (CARES) Act, a $2.2 trillion stimulus bill in response to the pandemic, along with numerous additional stimulus measures that have continued into 2021. As a result, per capita disposable income has continued to grow despite the pandemic, increasing an annualized 2.2% over the five years to 2021.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The value of construction is projected to expand over the next five years, rising an annualized 1.6% to $1.2 trillion. Additionally, the Federal Reserve is expected to keep interest rates low throughout much of the next five years in an effort to ensure that the economy returns to robust growth faster than after the previous recession. This is projected to increase available capital for personal and commercial loans, making borrowing less expensive. In turn, industry demand will likely rise as more households and businesses can affordably finance major renovations.
Interest rates are expected to remain low, making financing for renovations more affordable. As a result, residential construction is projected to expand an annualized 0.7% over the next five years.

Growth opportunities for the industry are also expected as the national housing stock continues to age. For example, according to the latest available data from the US Census Bureau's Annual Housing Survey, the median age of an owner-occupied home is 37 years, compared with only 29 years in 2001. Diving deeper into the data, the National Association of Home Builders finds that about two-thirds of owner-occupied homes were built before 1980, while 40.0% of such homes were erected before 1970.

industry_definition: This industry provides general maintenance and repair services to residential and commercial customers, including plumbing and electrical repairs, appliance installation and repair, painting and carpentry. IBISWorld's business franchise reports focus solely on franchised operations, excluding nonfranchise data. These reports, which show the total number of franchise

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: The industry's close ties to the residential construction market aided in its expansion
As Americans stayed home during the pandemic, many conducted DIY projects
Over the past five years, the industry has outperformed its nonfranchise counterparts
More homeowners are expected to outsource renovation projects to the industry
As interest rates remain low, more homeowners will invest in their homes
An aging US housing stock will lead to greater demand for repair workers
Homeowners have upped maintenance and repair expenditure overall to increase home values

market_segmentation.segment_description: Households generate the largest portion of revenue for the Handyman Service Franchises industry. Homeowners count on operators to perform such tasks as fixing a leaking faucet, changing settings, setting up playground equipment, hanging holiday lights, replacing missing shingles on the roof and repairing a door that sticks because they either do not have the time or skill set to complete the work themselves. According to the US Census Bureau, six out of 10 homeowners have seven or more projects on their home repairs to-do list. Replacing hard-to-reach light bulbs is the most commonly requested task of handymen, according to Entreprenuer.com.

Property owners and managers also make frequent use of industry services. In fact, this segment is expected to account for nearly 15.0% of total industry revenue in 2021. Over the past five years, the number of renting households has grown sharply due to increasing urbanization and difficulties in gaining access to credit for the purchase of a home. As the number of renters has risen during the current period, property managers and owners have increasingly turned to industry operators to complete remodeling projects. This segment has not been significantly affected by the pandemic, as industry services required by property owners and managers have not been altered by the coronavirus.

Demand from commercial clients is expected to account for an estimated 10.0% of industry revenue in 2021. Over much of the five years to 2021, operators expanded their presence in this segment. For example, Service Brands International, which operates Mr. Handyman franchises, has targeted more commercial clients while adding a greater range of remodeling projects for residential clients to diversify its revenue stream. Commercial clients rely on operators for maintenance, repair and remodel services, including bathroom projects (e.g., installing shower stalls or toilets; adding cabinets; laying new tile), cubicle assembly and drywall repairs. However, demand from this segment has been severely impacted by the coronavirus pandemic.

products_and_services.product_description: Handymen perform a range of interior and exterior maintenance services, including gutter cleaning and maintenance. Handymen clean gutters and can install gutter guards. Other maintenance services include repairing cabinets, changing furnace filters and weatherproofing, which is the process of insulating doors and windows to prevent outside air from entering.

In 2021, plumbing services are expected to account for an estimated 8.6% of total industry revenue. Demand for plumbing services has remained mostly stable over the past five years. This segment does not typically fluctuate dramatically, as most property owners are unwilling to sacrifice their standard of living by postponing necessary repair work on a building's piping. Additionally, this segment was shielded from the growing do-it-yourself (DIY) trend that threatened the industry early during the current period due to the complex nature of plumbing work, which prevented homeowners from performing repairs themselves.

Operators provide interior and exterior paint services, which can also require sanding or stripping for refinishing projects. Businesses can repaint one or multiple walls and doors. They can also perform touchups, in addition to removing scuff marks and repairing small holes with spackle. Painting and staining services generate an estimated 5.1% of industry revenue in 2021. Since simple paint jobs are far less complex than plumbing or electrical work, this market segment has been negatively impacted by the popularity of DIY projects. Although this trend receded in more recent years, it was challenged at as a result of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic, which allowed home-bound Americans with additional opportunities to complete painting work. Moreover, this segment faces steep competition from the Painters industry (IBISWorld report 23832). Consequently, demand for this market segment is expected to decline over the five years to 2021.

Handymen lay carpet, tile and hardwood. Residential and commercial clients turn to operators for these services because they are time and labor intensive. They also require specialized skills, as the process of laying flooring requires that the flooring's patterns and grains follow the same direction. Additionally, some flooring, including laminate, vinyl and linoleum, can involve the use of toxic chemicals in their installation. Demand for flooring, which accounts for an estimated 3.3% of industry revenue in 2021, rebounded over the past five years as housing construction and private spending on home improvement projects increased. However, this segment is expected to be challenged by the outbreak of the coronavirus pandemic since 2020, with private spending on home improvements declining significantly in 2020.

tier_1_suppliers: Electrical Equipment Wholesaling in the US
Tool & Hardware Wholesaling in the US
Construction & Mining Equipment Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Finance and Insurance in the US
tier_1_buyers: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for handyman services is largely dependent on consumer spending on home improvements and disposable income. As the US economy and residential construction expanded, so too does demand for industry services as homeowners increase spending on nonessential improvements. Consumers with higher disposable income are more likely to use industry services, while those with lower incomes typically delay or forego industry services if the repair is not severe.

Demand from potential franchisees regarding investment in a new franchise handyman service location is largely based on the market popularity of specific brands. When a brand's popularity is growing, potential franchisees are more likely to invest. After investigating the growth potential of a specific handyman service brand, most potential franchisees factor in the cost of investment into their demand.

Access to credit refers to the ability of an individual business or organization to borrow money from a lending institution. During the current five-year period, potential operators have benefited from improved access to credit enabling them to open more establishments.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The Handyman Service Franchises industry's service-based nature limits the opportunity for international trade. As a result, the industry records no import or export revenue.
While trade does not apply to the industry, operators display some degree of globalization through the ownership of foreign holdings.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region of the United States is home to an estimated 23.8% of industry establishments, which is slightly below its share of the country's total population (25.6%). The region contains Florida and North Carolina, which are home to 6.5% and 4.5% of the country's establishments, respectively.

With 19.0% of total establishments located in the West, this region is home to the second-highest concentration of handyman service franchises in the country. This region is home to California, which holds 11.0% of the country's total establishments, alone. California has long been a hotbed for housing activity. Additionally, the state's median household income is well above that of the national average. Consequently, homeowners are better able to afford outsourcing routine maintenance work or renovation projects to industry operators. Similarly, median household income for the West was also higher than the national average. As a result, this region's share of industry establishments is higher than its percentage of the country's total population, which is an estimated 17.2%.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Industry operators are subject to state regulations, as there is no national regulation for handymen. For example, New Jersey requires for-profit handymen to register with the state and carry insurance, while California mandates that they carry a license from the State Contractors License Board to work on any project that exceeds $500.00 in labor and material costs.
Industry operators are also subject to general labor laws on minimum wage, employee benefits, workplace conditions, workers' insurance and payment of health insurance coverage.

basis_points.basis_description: Industry participants primarily compete on price and quality of service.
Franchisees must compete with nonfranchise operators and contractors for some home repair jobs.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The top four operators account for less than 5% of total industry revenue in 2021.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases account for the largest expense for operators, comprising an estimated 46.1% of revenue in 2021. Franchisees purchase the equipment and tools needed for repair and maintenance services, which can include ladders, hammers, measuring tapes and light bulbs.

Wages are expected to account for 27.5% of revenue in 2021, down from 29.0% in 2016. The industry relies heavily on skilled labor to operate. Similar to franchises in other sectors, industry operators hire part-time workers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Handyman Service Franchises industry has a low level of capital intensity. The industry spends an average of $0.04 on capital for every dollar spent on labor in 2021.
Overall, this industry relies most heavily on its labor. In 2021, wages are expected to account for 27.5% of industry revenue.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Over the five years to 2021, the Handyman Service Franchises industry has been characterized by a moderate level of revenue volatility. This reflects steady demand from households for maintenance services.
However, industry demand still fluctuates due to its reliance on households, property managers and commercial clients, which are exposed to various external forces.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Technological changes have largely focused on website development, including greater usage of online mediums for scheduling appointments. Many industry participants offer customers the option of booking online or from their smartphones.

Additionally, franchisees are benefiting from developments in dispatch software technology, which provides information on technician and customer locations, inventory and traffic. Other technological developments have come in the form of software that performs scheduling or accounting functions.

FAQs.question: Does your company primarily work with residential or non-residential construction markets? Can you easily switch between these markets?
FAQs.answer: Residential construction is the largest market for the industry, as nearly all handyman work is done on small-scale projects.

FAQs.question: Does your company work to anticipate changes in sales based on current market performance?
FAQs.answer: Demand for industry services is largely dependent on activity in the residential construction sector, which in turn is generally used as an indicator for market performance. The cyclical nature of the construction industry can be used to anticipate changes in sales.

FAQs.question: What is the size of your staff? How does that compare to your competitors?
FAQs.answer: The industry is dominated by a large number of small operators. The average franchise establishment employs between 12 and 13 workers.

FAQs.question: Does your company make use of subcontractors to save on wage costs? Roughly, what percent of revenue is consumed by wages?
FAQs.answer: Subcontracted work is accounted for as a purchase cost. Subcontractors are often brought on seasonally when demand peaks.

FAQs.question: Investment in new technology is usually fairly low among builders and contractors. How much does your company invest in new equipment annually?
FAQs.answer: Operators must adapt to new technological change, but investment in new technology is relatively low in this industry.

FAQs.question: Have productivity issues ever kept you from winning lucrative contracts over larger competitors?
FAQs.answer: Operators that are most efficient typically win lucrative contracts, which places an emphasis on the competency of industry employees.

FAQs.question: Has complying with new energy-efficiency rules in various building codes driven up costs? How has your company offset these increases?
FAQs.answer: Complying with new energy-efficiency rules has not significantly driven up costs for industry operators. In contrast, energy-efficiency rules have benefited the industry, creating incentives for households to complete residential work.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met on and off the construction site?
FAQs.answer: There are strict health and safety requirements that all industry operators must follow. This includes the environment of their employees but also ensuring that their work is safe and in accordance with national standards.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare with your competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Generally, industry profit margins vary slightly between larger and smaller operators, with smaller operators achieving slightly lower profit margins, comparatively. Handyman services franchises have achieved higher margins than nonfranchised counterparts.

FAQs.question: How many of your clients are return customers?
FAQs.answer: For individual operators, customer loyalty is really important in sustaining demand in such a fragmented industry. Since services are generally homogeneous, many customers make hiring decisions based on reputation and their previous experiences with the industry operator.

FAQs.question: Are you known for your reliability and performance? Have you had any problems with reliability in the past?
FAQs.answer: Maintaining a reputation for quality and timeliness and maintaining good client relations is critical for the success of industry operators.

FAQs.question: Does your company keep up to date with the latest technology? What are the associated costs?
FAQs.answer: The capacity of handyman service franchises to adapt to changing technological requirements in the market and differentiate their service based on this capacity is critical for success.

FAQs.question: How do you ensure that all staff are thoroughly knowledgeable? Has it been easy to retain more knowledgeable staff?
FAQs.answer: Having employees with a high level of technical knowledge of products and services and end-user needs can be a competitive advantage.

FAQs.question: How do your clients typically pay for major renovations? How does your company take advantage of increased access to credit?
FAQs.answer: Many homeowners or businesses finance major renovations with borrowed money, so access to credit is crucial for industry demand.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your customers are commercial clients? Do you offer special deals for commercial clients? How can you take advantage of an increasing number of businesses?
FAQs.answer: Commercial clients use industry services such as cubicle assembly, carpentry and drywall repair. As the US economy recovered, the number of new businesses grew, providing industry operators with a larger customer base.

FAQs.question: Does an increase in private spending correlate with greater demand for your products? How will you adapt as private spending on home improvements declines?
FAQs.answer: Private investment in home improvement is a key driver for this industry. With housing construction anticipated to continue growing over the coming years, private spending on home improvement is expected to rise.
